Tell your legislator to oppose drug secrecy
Contact Your Legislator

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

This is urgent. The Arkansas General Assembly is so desperate to restart their gruesome assembly line of death that they're rushing through a bill that would hide the identities of drug manufacturers from the public.

Tell your legislators to oppose drug secrecy and vote NO on Senate Bill 464.

Two years ago, Arkansas officials rushed to execute eight men in 10 days, all to beat the expiration date on a risky drug linked to numerous botched executions.

One of the men they executed, Ledell Lee, was put to death having been denied DNA testing that could have proved his innocence. Another, Kenneth Williams, was seen lurching and convulsing during his execution.

Now state officials are trying to cover their tracks and make the death penalty even more prone to abuse by hiding the identities of drug manufacturers from the public.

We can't allow a veil of secrecy to facilitate another shameful rush to kill. Find your representative and tell them to oppose Senate Bill 464.

Senate Bill 464, which has already passed the Senate, would increase the risk of a botched execution and hide information from the public.

Take action to help us restore justice and end this cruel and barbaric practice once and for all.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Rita Sklar
Executive Director, ACLU of Arkansas
